subject: Season 5 Trailer Unveiled
event:
I was at the SuperBowl this past weekend.  Great game with a terrible ending.  But overall, still an amazing experience.

Others -- millions of others, actually -- were at IMAX theatres across the land, for the special IMAX screenings of episodes 9 and 10 from the fourth season of GAME OF THRONES.  I would have loved to have seen that too, but alas, there's no Imax near me.  

Those who did make it to an Imax saw the first full-length trailer for season five.

For those who were not, like me, here it is in all its glory.  Enjoy.

<lj-embed id="541"/>

comments.article:
Having seen it, I believe you are absolutely correct in wanting HBO to make the series finale episode(s) into a proper movie (unless you were misquoted on that?)
The Castle Black sequence was unbelievable, especially when you remember they are operating on a TV budget.
Congratulations on all the success! :)
My captain, that looked beautiful.

I was one of those fortunate millions to see the trailer in an IMAX theater. It was a lot of fun. Episode 10 was my favorite episode of the series so far, so it was great to see it on a huge screen. Looking forward to the new season.

Now I am as excitable as Hodor with a tin of alphabetti spaghetti :p

Really can't wait for this. Is there any chance Mors Westford or Alester Sarwyck will make the transition from the video game to the books? I really loved the story of that game, would easily put it in my top 3 RPG stories ever in a video game.
comments.subject: I shouldn't have watched that.

comments.article: Can't wait for next season! The battle for the Wall was just spectacular on the Imax screen. I'm so glad I spent 4 hours in the car just to see it. :)
Don't forget to remind people of the second episode of TellTale's game that just went live!
comments.subject: TellTale Game

comments.article: Excellent as always.  I'll always prefer your books, but this show has done you proud.
Where's Hodor? Hodor!
comments.subject: Trailer

comments.article: Hodor and Bran are sitting this season out.
comments.subject: Re: Trailer

comments.article:
The IMAX screening was amazing!

Can't wait for season five!

(And I agree with you about the Super Bowl).

Hey George,

Trailer looks great -- looks like it will be a good season. Looks like we could be headed ahead of the books in a few storylines. Did you have any say in that happening or not? Is it hard for you knowing that your reader fan-base might be getting some spoilers from all the high publicity surrounding the show?
comments.subject: New info

comments.upictitle: ryan, diesel, ty johnson, dirk vargas, ect.. ect..: Syd
comments.article: Saw the IMAX screening - the picture and the sounds were incredible! As for season 5, I recently bought an anthology of HP Lovecraft stories to keep me busy till April. I recognized a few names while reading, especially in The Doom That Came To Sarnath, and was wondering if there were any stories you'd recommend, or better yet, what your favorite is?
Great game all around, glad to see the refs had zero impact after a postseason of questionable calls and scandals.  Great night for the NFL
comments.subject: Great game

comments.article: The Super Bowl was great, period. From dejection to delirium and Vice versa. I was at a bar that was evenly split between the two supporters and it was the strangest thing I have seen in a long time. Season Five looks glorious.
comments.subject: re: Can Not wait

comments.article: We were in a gaming campaign and didn't address the football game or movies so this is a nice find today!
comments.subject: Thanks

comments.article: Thanks but no thanks. I'm kind of a reverse book reader, since I started with the shows usually I watch the season first than read the book that it covered. So I'm still in the dark as to what happens, and they just give away way too much in these trailers. Last year had clear images of the trial by combat among other things. Will be avoiding all trailers, comment sections, documentaries, twitters, until after the season.
Looks awesome man!
ready

Hello Mr.Martin

I am most excited to see a new world, culture, and house which is House Martell in Dorne.
What are you most excited for (or for us) to see this season ?

Thank you and Good day
comments.subject: so much excitement

comments.article:
Even though the trailer seems to have some scenes not available yet in the books (looks like there's some off-book Sansa action for example), every fiber of my being is so excited for April 12th.

I searched the web and couldn't find who did that cover (or remix/mash-up) of "Heroes" by Bowie. If anyone knows please comment.
comments.subject: Lovely!!!

comments.article: Some of that could be 'it's coming in Book Six', the other could be a 'change'.
comments.subject: Re: Lovely!!!

comments.article:
For me the TV series is fun to watch but it doesn't hold a candle to the novels.

I believe the real problem is with HBO's insistence on shocking viewers - even at the cost of dramatic tension. And for all their shocking additions to the novels, they somehow never capture the barbarity of Westeros culture. Reading about Raff recount The Mountain's rape of that little girl was more shocking that all the naked shots in the HBO series. The REAL red wedding was more dramatic than the SHOCKER OMG HE STABBED THE PREGGERS CHICK in the HBO version.

Shock shots are the crutch of inferior writers. And if they cut a few minutes of boob shots, they might actually be able to fit in vital plot lines - for example Tywin's orchestrated gang bang of Tyrion's first wife. But then, how would the feeble-minded writers at HBO even understand why that plot line was vital to Tyrion's character and motivations? Martin can lead the horse to water, but it sure ain't drinkin'!
comments.subject: Whatever

comments.article: Er... You do realize that GRRM writes for the show, don't you?
comments.subject: Re: Whatever

comments.article:
I'll always love the show because it introduced me to your series. But I would rather wait and read the storylines from TWOW/ADOS as opposed to watching the shows interpretation and budget friendly version. I'll most likely end up watching on Mondays after I find out from fan forums that it doesn't contain unpublished spoilers.

Oh and how about Harper Lee publishing her 2nd novel, a sequel to 'To Kill a Mockingbird' 55 years later? So all of us should shut up and put that in perspective with the next installments to ASOIAF.
comments.subject: Apprehensive to Watch This Year

comments.article:
I think net year is when we will all go in blind, regardless of what we've read.

Unless George surprises us before Season 6 begins.

Judging from my memory of book five, this season looks like it will adapt the rest of what is written.
comments.subject: Re: Apprehensive to Watch This Year
Re: Apprehensive to Watch This Year

comments.article: No new year's gift chapter from TWOW this year, so this trailer will have to do I guess :(

I think you misread something, George.

The show made millions, but millions definitely did not go... That would be insane.
comments.subject: Not millions

comments.article: Really excited to see how unsullied viewers react to that "Edd fetch me a block" scene.
comments.subject: Game of Thrones season 5

comments.article: Thank you so much for posting the trailer!
